info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 12:28PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Washington and northeastern Rensselaer Counties through 100 PM EDT... At 1227 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hoosick Falls, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Very heavy rain with these storms could cause ponding of water on roadways and in urban/poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Hoosick Falls, Cambridge, Hoosick, Lee, Pittstown, White Creek, Schaghticoke, Valley Falls, White Creek Station, Schaghticoke Hill, Center White Creek, Hoosick Junction, West Cambridge, Post Corners, Petersburg Junction, East Hoosick, Johnsonville, East Buskirk, Eagle Bridge and Crandall Corners. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
